reviews.review_msg: This class was online and was entirely ran by the TA. It was pretty easy as I put in next to know effort and got a B+ so I recommend taking this class for an upper division crim credit.

Class was run by the TA, zero contact with prof. Other than that, was a decent run-of-the-mill course. Three readings per week, and study questions. Quizzes every two weeks based off study questions. Weekly discussions, a 3 page paper, and 10-page final paper. "...Not great not terrible" - Dyatlov, HBO Chernobyl.

Took both 464 and 453 with him in the same semester. The class was completely run by TA's - did not have any contact with him. Only doing this review for the classes - they are both straight forward and set up the exact same way. A final paper, a paper outline, weekly discussions and quizzes every 2nd week. Were not very engaging courses.

Took 453 & 459 in the same semester with Bouchard. He is outstanding, very knowledgeable, and cares about his students. His classes require a lot of effort and are not easy, but if you do the weekly readings, participate, and put a lot of time into the term paper you'll be fine. Lots of laughs from his unique sense of humour. Highly recommend.

Martin is a great professor. He is very interested in the work he does and extremely knowledgeable. His class is NOT easy. He expects a high level of academic work from each one of his students. But he will ensure that you walk out of his class having learned something and he will always lend help or guidance if you need it

Definitely not an easy Prof. Don?t takes his class if you expect not to do anything and get a good grade.  Other than that, he is an amazing teacher for those who genuinely try and come to class prepared. His lectures are interesting and he is really knowledgeable.  Very funny and keeps everyone enticed. One of the best teachers by far.

I loved this class. He was fair and made it interesting to be there. You had to read all that was given to you but it wasn't impossible to do and I found myself looking forward to class. It wasn't an easy course but his teaching style made it enjoyable
